intro: Amphitecna kennedyae, commonly known as Kennedy's amphitecna, is a rare flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in areas with high saline conditions. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
